response.overview: In 2008, two comedians had a wild idea - so wild, it landed them in prison. Their mission? To bring a talent contest to the incarcerated, giving them a stage and a mic to express themselves. Filmed over 14 years, to show where the participants are now, attitudes, perceptions, and even the language around incarceration has evolved. This is the story of an improbable journey - and the unexpected impact of comedy, creativity, and second chances behind bars. Imagine "Borat" meets "America's Got Talent‚Äù behind bars, giving people a second chance at life. After receiving unprecedented prison access, directors Johnny Collins and Joel Jerome Dant produced an off-the-wall docu-comedy with actor and rapper Ice-T. A live Q&A on stage with director Johnny Collins will follow the performance.
response.title: Inmates with Talent
